title: How to Find a Mac Address on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s settings. This is the grey gear icon that is on the home screen of your iPhone. Here you can view its device settings and all customizable options.

steps.title: Tap on General.
steps.content: Tap on General . Scroll down the Settings screen and tap “General” from the list of options displayed on the menu list.

steps.title: Show your iPhone’s identity.
steps.content: Show your iPhone’s identity. Scroll down the General settings screen and select About from the list of options. This will show all the unique details about your iPhone, such as its IMEI, serial number, and more.

steps.title: Find the MAC address.
steps.content: Find the MAC address. Move down the About screen, and right below your iPhone’s model or serial number, you’ll find an item labeled Wi-Fi Address . This is your iPhone’s MAC Address. It’s a twelve-digit alphanumeric combination separated by pairs using a colon (:).
